title: Question: How are LP+/-'s decided?
body:
Just curious in understanding how +LP or -LP is decided as for the result of a game.
I've recently noticed that it's been almost impossible to climb my current div seeing as 1 win = 15 lp and 1 loss = 25 lp.
meaning that I have to win about 7 games in a row to hit promos but can potentially lose it all  in 4 losses.
What makes this stupidly difficult is that I can win 2 in a row ( 30LP), but then lose one (-25) - As a result of 3 potential hours of gameplay these are pretty discouraging numbers. If Lp gains/losses were equivalent, it wouldn't be so bad :/ then again, i don't really understand the reasoning behind this calculation ( if there is one ).

replies.body:
your MMR is lower than where you are in the tiers.

some people like to drop tiers to try to reset their MMR, but the best way is to just win lots...
still, 2-1 with a 5 LP gain ISNT bad. its just less than you hoped. back in the days of ELO you would get gains of 5-10 and loses of about that depending on MMR. sometimes i would win 5 and lose 3 and still only get +5 at the end.
Shame you missed out on the amazing days of tier 1 clamping when gaining 5 LP was seen as lucky 8)
